de.szut.dqi12.cheftrainer.server.databasecommunication

Class ServerPropertiesManagement

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.szut.dqi12.cheftrainer.server.databasecommunication.ServerPropertiesManagement

  • public class ServerPropertiesManagement
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to read/write server specific properties to the database.
    Author:
    Alexander Brennecke

    • Method Detail

      • setProperty

        public <E> void setProperty(java.lang.String property,
                            E value)
        This function will write the given property and the given value to the database. If the property already exist, than it will be updated. If it does not exist, it will be created.
        Parameters:
        property - the name of the property
        value - the value of the property

      • existProperty

        public boolean existProperty(java.lang.String property)
        This function checks, if the property with the given name exists in the database.
        Parameters:
        property - the name of the property
        Returns:
        true = property exists.

      • getPropAsBoolean

        public boolean getPropAsBoolean(java.lang.String property)
        This function reads the property with the given name and will return it as a boolean. The value of the given property must be a Integer
        Parameters:
        property - name of the property
        Returns:
        true = property was not "0", false otherwise

      • getPropAsString

        public java.lang.String getPropAsString(java.lang.String property)
                                 throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        This function reads the property with the given name and will return it as a String.
        Parameters:
        property - the name of the property
        Returns:
        the value as String
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - when there is no property with the given name.

      • getPropAsInt

        public java.lang.Integer getPropAsInt(java.lang.String property)
        This function reads the property with the given name and will return it as a Integer.
        Parameters:
        property - the name of the property
        Returns:
        the value of the property as Integer

      • getServerProps

        public java.sql.ResultSet getServerProps(java.lang.String property)
                                  throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        This function creates a SQLQuery, to read the given property from the database.
        Parameters:
        property - The name of the property, that should be read from the database.
        Returns:
        a ResultSet, that was returned from the SQLite driver after sending the query.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - when there is no property with the given name.
